title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement wjakethompson@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to dcmdata
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to dcmdata
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See tidyverse guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to dcmdata
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("r-dcm/dcmdata", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to dcmdata
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Data Sets for Diagnostic Classification Modeling
text: dcmdata contains real simulated data sets educational psychological assessment. information data set, see linked reference pages.

title: Data Sets for Diagnostic Classification Modeling
text: ECPE: Assessment data Examination Certificate Proficiency English, described Templin Hoffman (2013). MDM: short integer multiplication assessment, described MacReady Dayton (1977).

title: Data Sets for Diagnostic Classification Modeling
text: DTMR: data set based Diagnostic Teachers’ Multiplicative Reasoning assessment, described Bradshaw et al. (2014).

title: Data Sets for Diagnostic Classification Modeling
text: Contributions welcome. ensure smooth process, please review Contributing Guide. Please note dcmdata project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Diagnosing Teachers' Multiplicative Reasoning (DTMR) — dtmr_data
text: simulated data set modeled DTMR study described Bradshaw et al. (2014) Izsák et al. (2019). data simulated loglinear cognitive diagnostic model (LCDM), model used analyze data referenced articles. data set consists 990 responses 27 items included final version DTMR data, matching sample collected original authors. respondent randomly assigned mastery profile using profile proportions reported Figure 10 Izsák et al. (2019). Item responses generated respondent using assigned mastery profile item parameters reported Table 1 Bradshaw et al. (2014). Reproducible code generating simulated data available GitHub repository package.

title: Diagnosing Teachers' Multiplicative Reasoning (DTMR) — dtmr_data
text: dtmr_data tibble containing simulated DTMR response data 990 rows 28 variables. id: Respondent identifier. 1-22: Simulated dichotomous item responses 27 DTMR items. dtmr_qmatrix tibble identifies skills measured DTMR item, reported Bradshaw et al. (2014). DTMR assessment contains 27 items measuring 4 skills. dtmr_qmatrix correspondingly made 27 rows 5 variables. item: Item identifier, corresponds 1-22 dtmr_data. referent_units, partitioning_iterating, appropriateness, multiplicative_comparison: Dichotomous indicator whether skill measured item. value 1 indicates skill measured item value 0 indicates skill measured item. Using dtmr_true_structural values, randomly sampled mastery profile 990 respondents. true profiles respondent available dtmr_true_profiles. total 990 rows 5 variables. id: Respondent identifier, corresponds id dtmr_data. referent_units, partitioning_iterating, appropriateness, multiplicative_comparison: Integer values indicating whether attribute mastered respondent. use dtmr_true_profiles dtmr_qmatrix identify whether respondent possess attributes required item. Based attributes required possessed, use dtmr_true_items calculate log odds respondent providing correct response item. dtmr_true_items contains estimated item parameters reported Table 1 Bradshaw et al. (2014). tibble 27 rows 7 columns. item: Item identifier, corresponds 1-22 dtmr_data. intercept: LCDM intercept parameter item. referent_units: LCDM main effect parameter items measuring referent units attribute. partitioning_iterating: LCDM main effect parameter items measuring partitioning iterating attribute. appropriateness: LCDM main effect parameter items measuring appropriateness attribute. multiplicative_comparison: LCDM main effect parameter items measuring multiplicative comparisons attribute. referent_units__partitioning_iterating: LCDM interaction parameter items measuring referent units partitioning iterating attributes. Finally, convert log odds values probabilities draw random Bernoulli variable using probabilities correct response. drawn Bernoulli values simulated item scores make dtmr_data.

title: Diagnosing Teachers' Multiplicative Reasoning (DTMR) — dtmr_data
text: addition simulated data sets, true values used simulate data included reference. may useful , example, want estimate model check well estimated parameters match values used create data. simulate data, first need dtmr_true_structural. tibble contains structural parameters reported Figure 10 Izsák et al. (2019). structural parameters define probability observing possible profile population respondents. row represents one possible mastery profile. Therefore, 16 rows 5 variables. referent_units, partitioning_iterating, appropriateness, multiplicative_comparison: Integer values indicating whether attribute mastered respondents given profile. class_probability: proportion respondents estimated demonstrate given pattern mastery.

title: Diagnosing Teachers' Multiplicative Reasoning (DTMR) — dtmr_data
text: Bradshaw, L., Izsák, ., Templin, J., & Jacobson, E. (2014). Diagnosing teachers' understandings rational numbers: Building multidimensional test within diagnostic classification framework. Educational Measurement: Issues Practice, 33(1), 2-14. doi:10.1111/emip.12020 Izsák, ., Jacobson, E., & Bradshaw, L. (2019). Surveying middle-grads teachers' reasoning fraction arithmetic terms measured quantities. Journal Research Mathematics Education, 50(2), 156-209. doi:10.5951/jresematheduc.50.2.0156

what: Examination for the Certificate of Proficiency in English (ECPE) — ecpe_data
title: Examination for the Certificate of Proficiency in English (ECPE) — ecpe_data
text: data grammar section ECPE, administered annually English Language Institute University Michigan. data contains responses 28 questions 2,922 respondents, ask respondents complete sentence correct word. data set used Templin & Hoffman (2013) Templin & Bradshaw (2014) demonstrating log-linear cognitive diagnosis model (LCDM) hierarchical diagnostic classification model (HDCM), respectively.

title: Examination for the Certificate of Proficiency in English (ECPE) — ecpe_data
Examination for the Certificate of Proficiency in English (ECPE) — ecpe_data
text: ecpe_data tibble containing ECPE response data 2,922 rows 29 variables. resp_id: Respondent identifier. E1-E28: Dichotomous item responses 28 ECPE items. ecpe_qmatrix tibble identifies skills measured ECPE item. section ECPE contains 28 items measuring 3 skills. ecpe_qmatrix correspondingly made 28 rows 4 variables. item_id: Item identifier, corresponds E1-E28 ecpe_data. morphosyntactic, cohesive, lexical: Dichotomous indicator whether skill measured item. value 1 indicates skill measured item value 0 indicates skill measured item.

title: Examination for the Certificate of Proficiency in English (ECPE) — ecpe_data
text: skills correspond knowledge : Morphosyntactic rules Cohesive rules Lexical rules details, see Buck & Tatsuoka (1998) Henson & Templin (2007).

title: Examination for the Certificate of Proficiency in English (ECPE) — ecpe_data
text: Buck, G., & Tatsuoka, K. K. (1998). Application rule-space procedure language testing: Examining attributes free response listening test. Language Testing, 15(2), 119-157. doi:10.1177/026553229801500201 Henson, R., & Templin, J. (2007, April). Large-scale language assessment using cognitive diagnosis models. Paper presented Annual meeting National Council Measurement Education, Chicago, IL. Templin, J., & Hoffman, L. (2013). Obtaining diagnostic classification model estimates using Mplus. Educational Measurement: Issues Practice, 32(2), 37-50. doi:10.1111/emip.12010 Templin, J., & Bradshaw, L. (2014). Hierarchical diagnostic classification models: family models estimating testing attribute hierarchies. Psychometrika, 79(2), 317-339. doi:10.1007/s11336-013-9362-0

title: Generate Unique Identifiers — generate_ids
text: Create unique alphanumeric identifiers specified character length proportions alpha numeric characters.

title: Generate Unique Identifiers — generate_ids
text: n number unique identifiers generate. characters number characters included identifier. prop_numeric proportion characters numeric. default 1 (.e., numbers). less 1, identifiers also include lowercase uppercase letters. n_attempt number allowed attempts generating requested number identifiers. See details information. identifiers long (e.g., characters >= 10), slow computationally intensive find possible permutations specified number alpha numeric characters. Therefore, identifiers generated one time sampling required number characters. greatly increases efficiency, waste time generating multiple millions identifiers might need hundred. However, means possible generate duplicate identifiers. n_attempt argument allows us control many identifiers can generate order achieve desired n unique identifiers. fail find n unique identifiers n_attempt, function error. example, consider request 1,000 identifiers, 2 characters using numbers. number 0-9, 100 possible two-character permutations. Thus, n_attempt, function fail 1,000 unique identifiers found.

text: factor vector length n.

title: MacReady & Dayton Multiplication Data (MDM) — mdm_data
text: small data set multiplication item responses. data contains responses 4 items 142 respondents, ask respondents complete integer multiplication problem.

title: MacReady & Dayton Multiplication Data (MDM) — mdm_data
text: mdm_data tibble containing responses multiplication items, described MacReady Dayton (1977). 142 rows 5 variables. respondent: Respondent identifier. mdm1-mdm4: Dichotomous item responses 4 multiplication items. mdm_qmatrix tibble identifies skills measured MDM item. MDM data contains 4 items, measure skill multiplication. mdm_qmatrix correspondingly made 4 rows 2 variables. item: Item identifier, corresponds mdm1-mdm4 mdm_data. multiplication: Dichotomous indicator whether multiplication skill measured item. value 1 indicates skill measured item value 0 indicates skill measured item.

title: MacReady & Dayton Multiplication Data (MDM) — mdm_data
text: MacReady, G. B., & Dayton, C. M. (1977). use probabilistic models assessment mastery. Journal Educational Statistics, 2(2), 99-120. doi:10.2307/1164802
